https://amplab.cs.berkeley.edu/jenkins/job/SparkPullRequestBuilder/18229/consoleFull

@JoshRosen @liancheng regarding the iPython options, these are three setting combos we use frequently (and likely anyone else using notebooks): `notebook`, `notebook --pylab inline`, and `notebook --pylab inline --profile=nbserver`

@marmbrus  SparkSQLEnv.stop will clean up and shut down the Spark SQL environments. and it also call       sparkContext.stop() method.But maybe more clean up funcs will in SparkSQLEnv.stop in future, so use SparkSQLEnv.stop here is  more reasonable
@pwendell , can you verify this pr?  thanks~

@andrewor14 , @liancheng , the new commit includes improvement based on @liancheng 's great work. The main changes are as follows.

1) Improved utils.sh to force scripts which use utils.sh to set usage function
2) Modified spark-shell, pyspark to enable them to use arguments which include white spaces
3) Modified java_gateway.py to enable pyspark to use application opts.

I have tested this locally and I was able to get both spark shell and pyspark working as before. I also tried it with quoted arguments and backslashes and the arguments are still propagated properly. I haven't tried the settings file for spark-shell, however. Pending a few comments this LGTM, and we should get this in quickly if possible.

LGTM, thanks @sarutak and @liancheng.
Okay cool - we can merge this once the tests pass.
Ah, looks like it's not timing out on the build, but even the first test is hanging. I'll look more into why this is the case...
This issue is addressed in #1758 .
Hey @avati, you'll need to add an exclude in `project/MIMAExcludes.scala` so that this passes tests. It has correctly detected the compatibility break here.

I took a quick look - I'm not sure we want to change this. Just because only the first result is used right now doesn't mean we won't want to do something more sophisticated in the future. And donwstream consumers of  code could make the assumption that all failed fetches will be present.
